symptoms.name: Mucoid, mucopurulent, or purulent urethral discharge
Pain in scrotum or testicle (if epididymitis develops)
Swelling and pain in joints (reactive arthritis)
Meatitis
symptoms.pattern: In some cases of HSV urethritis

symptoms.name: Genital ulceration
symptoms.pattern: In some cases of HSV urethritis

symptoms.name: Conjunctivitis
symptoms.pattern: In some cases of adenovirus urethritis

symptoms.name: Meatal inflammation
symptoms.pattern: In some cases of adenovirus urethritis

physical_findings: Meatitis (in some cases of HSV urethritis)

NAAT (Nucleic acid amplification test).abnormal: Presence of C. trachomatis DNA or RNA

Gram stain.abnormal: Presence of gram-negative intracellular diplococci (GNID) indicating gonorrhea (often co-occurs with chlamydia)

Urethral swab culture.abnormal: Growth of C. trachomatis (less common and less accurate than NAAT)

risk_factors: Unprotected anal, oral, or vaginal intercourse
History of chlamydial infection or other STIs
Sexually active individuals under 25 years of age

supportive: Positive leukocyte esterase test on first-void urine
Microscopic examination of first-void urine sediment with ≥10 WBCs/HPF

differential_diagnoses: Other bacterial infections (e.g., Haemophilus influenzae, Corynebacterium species)
